required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of SCT200 in Patients With Advanced Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase Ib, Open-label, Single-arm, Multicenter Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of SCT200 in Patients With Advanced Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma Progressed Following Treatment With Taxane/Platinum/Fluorouracil

collaborator.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of recombinant anti-EGFR monoclonal antibody（SCT200）in patients with advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma progressed following treatment with taxane/platinum/fluorouracil.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a open label, single-arm multicenter phase Ib study,and is designed to evaluate Objective Response Rate (ORR) in advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma progressed following treatment with taxane/platinum/fluorouracil treated with anti-EGFR monoclonal antibody SCT200.

primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as proportion of patients achieving complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST v1.1 during trial treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: AE are assessed according to NCI CTCAE v4.03.
PFS is defined as the time from first dose of SCT200 until the date of first documentation of progression or date of death, whichever occurs first,according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.

DOR is defined as time from the date when a patient first meets the criteria for CR or PR according to RECIST v1.1, until the date that progressive disease (PD) is objectively documented or death, whichever occurs first
OS is defined as time from first dose of SCT200 until the date of death from any cause.

intervention.description: Experimental: Recombinant Anti-EGFR Monoclonal Antibody（SCT200）. Initially, SCT200 6.0mg/kg will be administered at day 1 every week for a maximum of 6 cycles. After 6 cycles SCT200 8.0mg/kg will be administered at day 2 every weeks until disease progression.

facility.name: The First Hospital of Jilin University
Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital
